derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (denoting the position of a military post commanding the length of a line): from French, from enfiler 'thread on a string, pierce from end to end', from en- 'in, on' + fil 'thread'

means.word_mean: 1. gunfire directed along the length rather than the breadth of a formation
1. rake or be in a position to rake with gunfire in a lengthwise direction

auth_sentence.content: The Germans installed concrete gun emplacements to enfilade the beaches.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Germans installed concrete gun emplacements to enfilade the beaches.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Germans installed concrete gun emplacements to enfilade the beaches.

auth_sentence.content: For, as designed, these breastworks take every advantage of the terrain and give us positions for a devastating enfilade.
